text: Hey, all. From my understanding HubSpot combines and minifies CSS (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/site-speed-and-performance-what-we-do-and-what-you-can-do>). On a page I'm testing, I have 1 main style sheet and several modules with module specific CSS. Is there a reason I wouldn't be seeing my module CSS being combined with the main style sheet? Right now I have 9 different style sheets when I view source. I'm expecting to see 1 single combined style sheet.
Can you share a preview link to the webpage?
This might be happening because you are linking to the stylesheets in the inspector on the right, in the custom module. Can you try to paste your styles in the CSS section in the module code editor?
are you referring to this panel in the individual module?
only 1 of the 7 modules on the page has linked files. would that 1 affect all of them?
Yes, it can. Please try to remove linked files.
Thanks. I removed the linked JS file from the module in question. Still no luck: <https://www.marconet.com/it-services?hsCacheBuster=7643>
Are you sure you do not have any linked stylesheets in any of the 7 modules?
Yep, just double checked. This is a older portal. I wonder if CSS combining isn't turned on? Or if that's even a possibility?
I agree. Looks like the minification process is happening but combining is not. I recommend you reach out to HubSpot support so that they can look into this portal and find out why.

Catching up - CSS combining is not performed if there are CSS errors in any of your css files, or visual rendering differences are caused by the page looking different before and after combining.

whether you are using linked CSS for modules has no bearing on that.
Hey <@U7SL518D6>. I'm not seeing any CSS errors in my main stylesheet or any of the module CSS. There would be some type of alert if there was an error, correct?

Howdy everyone, I just remade my header and footer on my main site (WP). I want to recreate it in Hub, but not sure the best way to go about it since our onboarding specialist is the one who made our header and footer. Any suggestions for the quickest approach?
